lines.text: Pop quiz, hotshot. There's a bomb on a bus. Once the bus goes 50 miles an hour, the bomb is armed. If it drops below 50, it blows up. What do you do? What do you do?
What is that smell?
It's gas.
We're leaking gas?
We are now.
What, you thought you needed another challenge or something?
All right, pop quiz. Airport, gunman with one hostage. He's using her for cover; he's almost to a plane. You're a hundred feet away... Jack?
Shoot the hostage.

[Payne wrestles with Jack for a deadman-switch detonator on top of a runaway subway train]
I'm smarter than you, Jack! I'm smarter! I'm smarter!
[Jack sees a hanging light approaching and forces Payne into its path. Payne looks up and screams before the light decapitates him]

[grabbing the detonator before Payne's body falls away]
Yeah? Well, I'm TALLER!
[last lines]
I have to warn you, I've heard relationships based on intense experiences never work.
OK. We'll have to base it on sex then.
Whatever you say, ma'am.
STOP! L.A.P.D! Get out of the car!
Hey man, this is MY car, I OWN this car, it's NOT stolen.

[pulls gun out and points it at him]
It is now. Move over.
So you're a cop, right?
That's right.
Well, I should probably tell you that I'm taking the bus because I had my driver's license revoked.
What for?
Speeding.
It's a game. If he gets the money he wins, if the bus blows up he wins.
What if you win?
Then tomorrow we'll play another one.
But I'm not available to drive tomorrow. Busy.
[Traven spots the explosive device (it's huge); Stephens is relaying his observations by cel-phone]
Fuck me!
"Oh, darn."
[after surviving the bus explosion]
You're not going to get mushy on me, are you?
Maybe. I might.
I hope not, 'cause you know, relationships that start under intense circumstances, they never last.
Oh yeah?
Yeah, I've done extensive study on this.
See, I'm in charge here! I drop this stick, and they pick your friend here up with a sponge! Are you ready to die, friend?
Fuck you!
Oh! In two hundred years we've gone from "I regret but I have one life to give for my country" to "Fuck you!"?
[Jack is helped onto the bus after trying to defuse bomb]
Did you have any luck with the bomb?
Yeah, it didn't go off.
You shot me, I can't believe it. They're giving you a medal for shooting me, you little prick!
Harry... you TOLD me to.
Tell me again Harry, why did I take this job?
Oh come on, thirty more years of this, you get a tiny pension and a cheap gold watch.
Cool.
You didn't leave me. I can't believe it... you didn't leave me.
Didn't have anywhere to be just then.
You're crazy! You're fuckin' crazy!
NO! Poor people are crazy, Jack. I'm eccentric.

[drunk]
Well, I'm gonna go home, have some sex.
Harry, you're gonna go home and puke.
Well that'll be fun too.
Miss, can you handle this bus?
Oh sure. It's just like driving a really big Pinto.
[repeated phrase]
Don't get dead.
This day has been rather disappointing, I don't mind saying.
Why, because you didn't get to kill everyone?
There's gonna come a time, boy, when you will wish you never met me.
Mister, I'm already there!
Anything else that'll keep this elevator from falling?
Yeah. The basement.

[Dismayed]
We're at the airport.
Yeah, so?
I already seen the airport.
You're not too bright, man, but ya got some big round hairy cajones.
That's very gross, Ortiz.
Huh, can't even pay him a compliment.
Guts'll get you so far, then they'll get you killed.
Just keep it steady.
Oh, thank you for the tip, Ortiz.
Harry! Tell me good news, man.
Oh, I'm sorry, Jack. He didn't make it.
You FUCK!

It was the watch that led him to me, wasn't it? Huh? It seemed a little hammy to me to build a bomb out of my precious retirement gift, but, you know, I figured a sign that said "Howard Payne" would be pushing it.
I'm gonna rip your fucking spine out, I swear to God.
Are they going to help us?
Sure they are, they're the police. Hey, your taxes are paying their salaries. We die, they gotta take a pay cut.
What do you think?
You're the expert, I just work here.
Looks pretty solid.
Anyone we know?
I don't recognize the work, but he's pro.
[checks watch]
Oh, he's cutting it close.
I don't like it.
What's to like? Mac said we hold, so we hold.
[Jack begins looking around; Harry thinks]
Alright, pop quiz. Airport, gunman with a hostage. He's using her for cover. He's almost to a plane. You're one hundred feet away.
[Jack doesn't respond]
Jack?
Shoot the hostage.
What?
Take her out of the equation. Go for the good wound and he can't get to the plane with her. Clear shot.
You're deeply nuts, you know that? "Shoot the hostage."
[chuckles]
Harry, this is wrong. He's gonna blow it anyway.
Why?
I don't know, gut feeling.
Yeah, well, right now Mac outranks your gut. So we sit.
How much you think that elevator weights?
Jack, come on!
Maybe we can do something about those hostages.
We're not gonna shoot em right?
Was it good for you?
It was great for me.
Elevator dropped.
Oh, that's good to know.
[both sit down]
Is your watch slow?
No, no, he jumped the gun. We had three minutes left.
Why's he do that? He's losing his three million.
I don't know maybe he couldn't hold his wad long enough. It's a common problem among middle-aged men. So I'm told.

[gets up; realizing]
He's here.
He could have blown that thing from Pacoima!
No, he knew we were up to something. He's close by.
He's not gonna corner himself in a building. We evacuated anyways.
[Jack looks disappointed]
Alright. He'd wanna be here but he'd wanna stay mobile. Right?
[Jack nods]
The elevators.
The passenger cars were stopped. They checked em out.
What about the freight elevators?

[answering phone]
Harry! Tell me good news man.
Oh, I'm sorry Jack. He didn't make it.

[realizes; slight pause]
Fuck!

It was the watch that lead him to me, wasn't it? It seemed a little hammy to me, to build a bomb out of my precious retirement gift. But you know, I figured a sign that said "Howard Payne" would be pushing it.
I'm gonna rip your fucking spine out, I swear to God.

You're gonna do exactly as you're told! Jack, we both know he was the brains of your particular operation. You can't beat me, you're gonna pay me every dollar. Otherwise, you, the wildcat, and every innocent person on that bus, are gonna end up just like your friend. You paying attention? Jack, you listening to me? Jack? Jack!
Yeah...

Good! Now you tell them that the drop point is Pershing Square. You drop the bags and leave. I don't show until all your people are gone. It's getting on to 11 AM, Jack, and I think it's gonna be a very pretty day.
[laughs nefariously]
[hangs up; Jack flips out]
Jack stop it! We're really scared and we need you right now. I can't do this by myself! Jack, please?

[chuckles]
We're gonna die.
No we're not. We got this far alright?
[Jack looks at Annie's jacket]
I'll be damned. You go to the University of Arizona?
Yeah, so?
Good football team.
Yeah? I guess so, I wouldn't know.
Arizona Wildcats.
Right...
He can see you.
What?
He can see you. Just keep looking straight ahead.

[Jack looks around; finds the camera]
He called you a Wildcat before. I didn't even pick up on it. Bastard's got a camera right in your face. He can see the whole bus. He's been playing me from minute one.
Well, he can see me but can he hear me?
Doesn't look like it he's just watching you.
[after the elevator falls]
Jesus. Bob, what button did you push?

You think I wouldn't have been prepared? Two years I spent setting up that elevator job, two years I invested in it. You couldn't understand the kind of commitment that I have. You ruined a man's life's work and you think you can walk away? You got blinders on to the world! But I got your attention now, didn't I Jack?

[distressed]
Why didn't you just come after me?
No this is about ME! This is about my money, this is about money DUE ME! Which I WILL collect! 3.7 Million dollars! It's my nest egg, Jack, at my age you have to think ahead.

[angry]
When I find you...

[cuts him off]
Pop quiz, hotshot. There's a bomb on a bus. Once the bus goes 50 miles an hour, the bomb is armed. If it drops below 50, it blows up. What do you do? What do you do?
I'd want to know what bus it was...
You think I'm going to tell you that?
Yes.
Aha, very good. There are rules, Jack, and I want you to get this right. NO ONE goes off the bus. If you try to take any passengers off the bus, I will detonate it. I want my money by 11AM.
We can't pull that kind of money in time!

[shouting]
FOCUS, JACK! Your concern is the bus. And don't try to call. The radio's down. Now, the number of the bus is 2525, it's running downtown from Venice. It's at the corner of Ocean Park & Main.
[Jack takes off for his car as sirens from approaching fire engines can be heard]
[after remotely killing a hostage, then promptly hearing about it on the TV news]
Interactive TV, Jack! Wave of the future - ha ha ha, huh?

[after taking Maurice's car and breaking off the door]
Sir I'm gonna need to take your phone.
Take the phone!

A bomb is made to explode. That's its meaning. Its purpose. Your life is empty because you spend it trying to stop the bomb from becoming. And for who? For what? You know what a bomb is, Jack, that doesn't explode? It's a cheap gold watch, buddy.
Alright gentlemen, what we have here is 13 passengers in a express elevator. Below floor 30. Bomber's already taken out cables, bomber wants $3 million or he blows the emergency brakes.
What's our clock?
He gave one hour. That leaves us twenty-three minutes exactly.
Anything else that will keep this elevator from falling?
Yeah, the basement.
The city would like to avoid that event, Officer Traven.
We can't just unload the passengers?
This is an express elevator gentlemen. The only way in or out is through access panels. Bomber's also wired the hatch to trigger the bomb, which seats him in the crazy-but-not-stupid section.
Sir, Harry volunteers to examine the device.
Yeah, right.
Fine. The two of you check it out.
The nearest access panel is on the thirty-second floor in the lobby.
I want reports only, we're in a holding patern. Worthy, Briggs, I want you to secure base area, no one in or out. Everyone else, I want you to confirm building evac. Move!

[to Harry]
Looks like we're walking.
Annie.
What?
That's my name, Annie.
Annie.
As opposed to "ma'am"?
Harry, there's enough C-4 on this thing to put a hole in the world!
First time in LA.
Oh no, I live here.
No, mine. Oh that's just funny, you heard me wrong. Nah, I'm sight-seeing.
Oh, really?
Yeah. I hate to use the word 'tourist,' but it's not like I can hide it...
Not really.

[sigh]
Did you know it took me three hours to get here from the airport? I got so lost. LA's one big place, but I guess you don't notice, seeing as you live here. I'm such a yokel. There, I said it!
Oh jeez. You know what? I got gum on my seat, GUM!
[sits on a different bus seat nearer the front]
[Annie has just driven the bus into a woman's baby carriage]
Oh my God, oh my God.
It's cans. It's Ok, it's cans.
What?
They were just cans.
Jack, nothing tricky now. You know I'm on top of you! DO NOT attempt to grow a brain!
He's the asshole, Annie, the guy who puts us here. Remember that, ok?
Big asshole.
I'm telling ya, honey, he's somewhere jerking off.
He didn't have to get ON the bus in the first place, Ortiz. Hey, get your ass behind the yellow line!
Be prepared! This is the Boy Scout marching song.
There's gum on my seat... GUM!
[the bus has just entered LAX]
He's just entered the airport.
The airport? There's thousands of people there.
All right! That's my boy Jack! We should be able to circle the runways and buy us some time. The choppers can't fly in there; it's restricted air space.
He's headed for the end of the field.
That must be Bravo Tango, an emergency runway.
Yeah, let's hope it's built. Let's move!
[Jack is trying to get Sam's attention]
Hey!
[honks horn repeatingly]
I'm a cop! LAPD! There's a bomb on your bus! There is a bomb on your bus!
What?
There's a -WHAT? FUCK!

[after contemplating a solution]
Maybe we can do something about these hostages.
We're not gonna shoot them, right?
Will the mystery guest please sign in?

[repeating what a news reporter just said]
"The whim of a madman" - I like that!
And here... is to Harry. For his quick thinking... for his grace under pressure, and for his brave and selfless act.
[everyone cheers]
And to Jack for shooting Harry. Something we've all wanted to do for a very long time.

[Jack has just killed Payne on the train roof]
Where is Payne?
He lost his head.
Yeah?
I think we have trust, but it looks on TV like you're trying to get those passengers off the bus.
Look, you've got to let me have one.
We went over the rules.
As an act of faith. We have an injured man here. The driver's been shot.
Jack, tell me that you haven't been shooting the passengers. I thought it was customary for a police officer to shoot the bad guys.
This man has no time.
No one gets off!
It'll grease the wheels with the money men if you show some charity. There's still gonna be plenty of us to kill.
OK, son, you can try and unload the driver. You tell that wildcat behind the wheel not to slow down, though, or he won't even get a chance to bleed to death. And, Jack, don't slip.
What do you think, Jack? You think you pick up all the bus driver's teeth they'll give you another medal?
Jeez...

You think I wouldn't have been prepared? Two years I spent, setting up that elevator job. Two years I invested myself in it. You couldn't understand the kind of commitment I have. You ruined a man's life's work and you think you can walk away? You got blinders on to the world! But I got your attention now, didn't I Jack?
Why didn't you just come after me?
Now this is about my money. This is about money due me. Which I collect. $3.7 million. It's my nest egg, Jack - at my age you gotta think ahead.
When I find you...
Oh, quiz hot shot. There's a bomb on a bus, once the bus goes 50mp/h, the bomb is armed. If it drops below 50, it blows up. What do you do? What do you do?
I'd wanna know what bus it was...
You think I'm gonna tell you that?
Yes.
Aha, very good. There are rules, Jack, and I want you to get this right. No one goes off the bus. You try to take any passengers off the bus, I will detonate it. I want my money by 11 A.M.
We can't pull that kind of money in time!
Focus, Jack! Your concern is the bus. And don't try to call. The radio's down. Now, the number of the bus is 2525, it's running downtown from Venice. It's at the corner of Ocean Park & Main.
[Jack jumps from Maurice's car onto the bus]

[repeatedly]
Whoa, shit!

[crashes into the barrels of water]
Whoa, SHIIIITT!
Do not fuck with daddy!
[after five minutes worth of screaming from the armed elevator]
Usually they fall down now.

[Shows Harry a newspaper clipping]
Howard Payne, Atlanta P.D. Bomb Squad! Retired to Sun Valley in 1989 when a small charge left him with fingers numbering nine!
Ok, Jack, this is it. Don't get dead.
Hey! Get your ass behind the yellow line.
It's okay. If you need to, you go right ahead and vomit.
[Payne points a shotgun at Jack's face]
I don't suppose anybody'll give me three million just for you?
What do you think, Jack? You think if you pick up all the bus driver's teeth, they'll give you another medal?
[first lines]
Hey, this area's restricted.
Oh, hi. Yeah, I know. They called me down here. Some of this wiring got screwed up.
Nobody called it down to me. I'm going to have to see a work order.
Yeah, just a second. There you are.
[stabs workman in the ear with a screwdriver]
Nothing personal.

[Bob pushes elevator button that has already been pushed]
Thanks for pushing that, Bob. The light's on but you never know, it really might be broken.
Shut up.
You've gotta let me off.
Oh, no! That's not good!
You're fired! Everybody's fuckin' fired!
[after five minutes worth of screaming from the armed elevator]
Usually they fall down now.
I hate talking to negotiators, Jack. They talk to you like they're your best friend and they don't even know you.
[the bus is caught in a gridlock]
Hey, Sam?

[whispers under his breath]
Shit!
SAM!
What?
Why don't you just drive around these people?
Don't spit on my bus, Annie.

[to Annie, who is crying and hysterical with fear]
Hey, buck up! It's not because you're a woman.
